intro: Goniothalamus gabriacianus, commonly known as the Gabriacian mountain banyan, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. It thrives in humid, lowland forests and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
